posts.post_content:
"Tonight we drink, to card advantage!"  
  
Fantastic ability, you'll be targetting yourself more often than not, as others have mentioned similar to [Phyrexian Arena](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Arena) or [Dark Confidant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Confidant), although Bob will never truly be replaced, this is about as good as it is going to get. Fact that he can beat face helps alot too and if REALLY need that one last point of damage you can target opponents with the ability. Not too shabby for {3}{B}{B}
posts.html:
"Tonight we drink, to card advantage!"

Fantastic ability, you'll be targetting yourself more often than not, as others have mentioned similar to Phyrexian Arena or Dark Confidant, although Bob will never truly be replaced, this is about as good as it is going to get. Posted By: Hayw00d0909 (9/22/2011 6:06:35 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Ran this card in a sealed event last night. It was pivotal in a couple of my wins (including a game where I actually finished my opponent off with the card draw/life loss ability), but it also cost me a game where I foolishly dinged myself down enough to let a [Brimstone Volley](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brimstone Volley) kill me. Still, there seems to be something particularly appropriate about a Demon's ability coming back to bite you in the arse.
posts.html:
Ran this card in a sealed event last night. It was pivotal in a couple of my wins (including a game where I actually finished my opponent off with the card draw/life loss ability), but it also cost me a game where I foolishly dinged myself down enough to let a Brimstone Volley kill me. Still, there seems to be something particularly appropriate about a Demon's ability coming back to bite you in the arse.

Posted By: Nagoragama (9/24/2011 5:36:05 PM)
Rating:

@Darthparralax: shut up. This and Griselbrand fill up very different niches, you know? You're comparing apples to oranges here.
Even in Kaalia or reanimator, Gris isn't strictly better than this. If for some reason you fail to cheat it into play, try getting 8 mana (4 of it color-specific) with the amount of accel and fixing Kaalia decks usually run. I dare you.

That said, I love this card to death. Both artwork and mechanics. Wizards seem to be hellbent on printing powerful black spells attached to demons lately, don't they? This and Phyrexian Arena, Reaper from the Abyss and The Abyss, Griselbrand and Necropotence, Rune-scarred Demon and Demonic Tutor...

posts.post_content: I love seeing a noob target his opponent with this. I saw a kid the other day, and I was playing him, I played this, and he said, "Oh, that's not a good card. Great card.  
Of course, [Phyrexian Arena](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Arena) is much better, because it costs only three mana and is much harder to get rid of. Still this demon is awesome and even better in 2HG games where you can make your teammate draw cards.

posts.post_content:
Whoah. Damn.  
  
This might already be replaced...  
  
Kaalia of the Vast can now play [GRISELBRAND](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=GRISELBRAND)  
  
Q:Umm why wouldn't I play both of these cards?  
  
A:Because as great as Innistrad set is, it has nothing on Avacyn Restored set. I can't remotely imagine a Kaalia deck that doesn't run a huge percentage of its cards straight from this Block though.  
  
There MIGHT be room for this card in Kaalia still. Wow. That sentence wouldn't have made sense a year ago. Wow. Kaalia is the stupidzonkersbrokenest General in the game xD  
  
LashofDragonbreath: Of the quality Dragons, Demons, and Angels that are out there? There are so many Angels. Unless you disregard Deck Synergisms and play a kind of TimmyForever-style Kaalia Deck, looking for all of the cards that look most like [Akroma, Angel of Wrath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Akroma, Angel of Wrath).  
  
Your insight about Demons and Epic Spells stapled to them is true, and in the months since, it's become ludicrously pushed with Angels as well. We have [Gisela/au](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gisela/au)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
